Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a threat to democracy and free speech.
Granting government authority to control information is viewed as totalitarian and Orwellian.
Historical examples, such as Nazi Germany, are cited to illustrate the dangers of government control over information.
The government is perceived as incapable of managing information without bias or malice.
Recent government actions during the COVID-19 pandemic are used as examples of misinformation and disinformation.
The government's environmental and defense policies are criticized as inconsistent and illogical.
Notable Quotes: Any Government authority given the power to control our right to speak and/or listen freely to a wide platform of information sources is totalitarian and Orwellian by its very nature.
If we do not learn from history we are doomed to repeat it.
One only has to see and hear the Misinformation and Disinformation dished out by our government health departments to our populace over the last 3 years, regarding the COVID pandemic.
